intro: Polygala vulgaris var. major, commonly known as the greater milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems and alternate, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense racemes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and grasslands.
